questions.question_text: What setting allows users to view a Knowledge Base article even if they are not logged in?

discussion.content: A is correct

This Question is really confusing. I wonder if it's from an outdated version ServiceNow or I just don't understand it, but in the Vancouver CSA fundamentals book it's clearly stated that "If there's no user criteria specified in the "Can Read" related list then the Knowledge Base becomes open to the public." Same is the information in the ServiceNow forums: "To make a Knowledge base public navigate to Knowledge > Administration > Knowledge Bases. Select the knowledge base you want to make public. Go to the Can Read section or tab and remove any entries from the list. That way everyone gets read permission on all articles in that knowledge base." 
I could not find any information anywhere about a specific "Public setting". 
Nevertheless, I would probably have to go for answer A as the other ones are even more meaningless.

comments.content: The key item to note in the question is that the user is NOT logged in. If the person is not even logged in then there is no authentication or access control to consider. Itâ€™s a public user and therefore the article must have public setting. Anyone on the internet can view it.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer

comments.content:
Can you pls give me your account details... I need to study bro...
My Reddit: Conscious_Can_2005

Or Can you pls drop any comment in every question bro.... Please bro...

discussion.content: The setting that allows users to view a Knowledge Base article even if they are not logged in is called "Public Knowledge Base". This setting can be enabled or disabled by ServiceNow administrators in the Knowledge Base Service Portal application.

Chatgpt says ACE for Washington DC release
A. Problem==Parent
C. Catalog Task -> Parent
E. Release Phase==Parent

Selected Answer: BCD
A. Problem==Parent - Problem alone re. list is not given but Problem Task
B. HR Case->Parent - correct
C. Catalog Task->Parent - correct
D. Outage->Task number - correct
E. Release Phase==Parent - == / ->

Chat GPT choose ACD, and I am with in : 
These options indicate the relationships between the records. For example:

Problem->Parent: Shows related problems where the current record is the parent.
Catalog Task->Parent: Displays catalog tasks related to the parent record.
Outage->Task number: Lists outages associated with a specific task number.

I see in the related list : Problem->Parent but the operator == is not their anymore, I see also outage-> Task number and Catalog Task-> Parent so for me CD I see them but HR Case not their anymore and for Release Phase-> Parent is their but the operator == no. so for me I am sure with CD

questions.question_text: When adding a related list to a form, you choose the related list from the list collector. What is an example of a related list you might see on the list collector? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
checked in Notification module, when to send-> send when(event is fired)->event name(system.upgraded)

Selected Answer: B
Even not knowing for sure if there's a "System Upgraded" notification out of the box, I would go with B - First of all notifications are available in System Notification -> E-mail -> Notifications (so that rules out A), second of all why would the administrator want to send a notification for a completed upgrade (through a Client Script or a Business Rule) to himself? That rules out C and D. So B is the only plausible one.
But to confirm my logic I also went in and checked in my out of the box personal development instance and there is indeed a "System Upgraded" notification in System Notification -> E-mail -> Notifications

Selected Answer: B
There is a "System Upgraded" notification. Head to System Notification -> Notification and type "*upgrade" in the name, you will see the "System Upgraded" Notification. 

For the Exam I would choose A

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D
D is correct "system upgraded" is not an out of box notification

Most likely answer is D
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-application-development/page/script/business-rules/concept/c_BusinessRules.html
I thick D is the correct answer

choices.D: Administrators can write a Business Rule to send out an email to the Administrator when an Update is complete.
choices.C: Administrators can write a Client Script to send out an email to the Administrator when an Update is complete.
choices.A: Administrators can update the email notification named "System Upgraded" in the System Logs module by adding the appropriate User to receive it.
choices.B: Administrators can update the email notification named "System Upgraded" in the Notifications module by adding the appropriate User to receive it.

questions.question_text: How is the ServiceNow platform set up so that Administrators can easily configure their instances to send an email at the end of an upgrade?
A customer wants to be able to identify and track components of their infrastructure that support their eCommerce service. What ServiceNow products could support this requirement? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
Asset Management is out of scope for CSA.

comments.content: Also, Asset Mgmt is not a SN product.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
BCD - Correct. 

C - correct, CMDB for obvious reasons
B- per Washington doc, Discovery scans the network to inventory devices
D- per Washington doc, Service Mapping or Top-Down Discovery augments the CDMB with IT relationships and dependencies.

Selected Answer: BCD
https://www.servicenow.com/blogs/2023/steps-better-infrastructure-visibility.html#Adopt%20A%20Phased%20Plan%20of%20Attack

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC makes the most since to me based off of google searches, comments, and ServiceNow documentation.

Selected Answer: ABC
A - Asset Management is the first Application in ServiceNow that I learned about prior to studying for CSA. That is where items are identified.

B - Discovery is used to Track Components

C - CMDB is the base for the entire system.

D - Service Mapping - works hand in hand with Discovery.
https://www.servicenow.com/lpwhp/application-context-infastructure.html
it is ABD

Selected Answer: BCD
A is correct in practice but I don't believe it's actually a topic from the CSA course. BCD are correct and definitely covered topics.

Selected Answer: ABC
"Their infrastructure" is handled with "Asset Management" 
"Discovery" can collect the assets
CMDB stores the asset information

Selected Answer: BCD
BCD is Correct.

Selected Answer: BCD
BCD seems more appropriate

the wording of the question does not make sense. It should probably be: Which type of tables may be extended by other tables, but are not extended from another table? Or 'do not extend from another table'.
Base tables are those tables which are extended, but itself is not an extended table.

Selected Answer: A
base tables like task

1. base class table: not extended from another table
2. Parent class table: maybe extended from another table

A is correct
